title: Various text from 50’s French film trailer
content:
Various display text from a trailer of “Bob le flambeur”. Some condensed sans, some modern serif. (To clarify: I’m looking for suggestions to any similar fonts).

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-05-17%20at%2000.57.36.JPG) | 73.02 KB |
| [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-05-17%20at%2001.00.19.JPG) | 86.35 KB |
| [3](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-05-17%20at%2000.59.10.JPG) | 79.04 KB |
| [4](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-05-17%20at%2001.00.05.JPG) | 91.54 KB |
| [5](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-05-17%20at%2001.00.56.JPG) | 111.65 KB |
author: sanderpe

comments.content: All handlettered, as was common practice in the 1950s.
Yes, I assumed they were hand lettered, but I’m curious to know if there are any fonts that are closely similar, especially to the first sans serif.

[Radiant Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/radiant-cond/) or [Roxy](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/ROXY/fonts/) are similar, but you'd have to modify the **S** and the **Q** to match this sample.

Some similarity to the the first image, i.e. the lettering \_SYMPATHIQUE\_, Atto Sans [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/wilton/atto-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831053150/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wilton/atto-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/wilton/atto-sans/") S is close.  
Don
Have a look at Corvinus Skyline.
